intro: Licania sprucei, commonly known as the Brazilian spruce, is a flowering plant species native to the Amazon rainforest. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its large, palmately lobed leaves. The plant produces showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting various pollinators. Licania sprucei is typically found in moist, shaded environments within the dense understory of tropical forests. Its ecological role includes providing habitat and food for native wildlife.
